DCL Structures, Enumerations, and Handles

Send comments on this topic.

Summary

DCLDATETIME   The DCLDATETIME is a structure used to hold date and time information.
DCLENVHANDLE   A DCLENVHANDLE is an opaque pointer which is used to reference an "environment" object which is created with DclEnvCreate().
DCLFSDIRHANDLE   DCLFSDIRHANDLE is an opaque pointer to a directory object which was opened with DclFsDirOpen().
DCLFSFILEHANDLE   DCLFSFILEHANDLE is an opaque pointer to a directory object which was opened with DclFsFileOpen().
DCLFSSTAT   The DCLFSSTAT structure type contains file system information returned by DclFsStat().
DCLFSSTATFS   The DCLFSSTATFS structure type contains file system information returned by DclFsStatFs().
DCLHRTIMESTAMP   A DCLHRTIMESTAMP type is used to track high-res timer infor- mation.
DCLINSTANCEHANDLE   A DCLINSTANCEHANDLE is an opaque pointer used to refer to a DCL instance.
DCLIOSTATUS   Contains the results of an I/O request.
DCLLOADERFILEHANDLE   Type for a DL loader file handle.
DCLLOADERHANDLE   Type for a DL loader instance handle.
DCLLOGHANDLE   A DCLLOGHANDLE is used to reference a logging object which is created with DclLogOpen().
DCLPROJECTHANDLE   A DCLPROJECTHANDLE is an opaque pointer used to refer to a project instance.
DCLREADERIO   Type for a DL loader block device instance handle.
DCLSERVICEHANDLE   A DCLSERVICEHANDLE is an opaque pointer used to refer to a service instance.
DCLSTATUS   A structured status code used to return error/status information.
DCLTHREADATTR   The DCLTHREADATTR type is an opaque structure used to store thread attributes.
DCLTHREADHANDLE   The DCLTHREADHANDLE type is an opaque pointer to a thread object which was craeted by DclOsThreadCreate().
DCLTHREADID   The DCLTHREADID type is used to store a thread ID, as returned by DclOsThreadID().
DCLTIMER   A DCLTIMER structure is used by the timer services to track timing information.
DCLTIMESTAMP   A DCLTIMESTAMP type is used to track timer information.
DCLTOOLPARAMS   A structure used to pass parameters to tests and tools.
PDCLMUTEX   The PDCLMUTEX type is an opaque pointer to a mutex object which was created with DclMutexCreate().
PDCLSEMAPHORE   The PDCLSEMAPHORE type is an opaque pointer to a counting semaphore object which was created with DclSemaphoreCreate().
PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR   The PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR type is an opaque pointer to a read/write semaphore object which was created with DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate().

DCLDATETIME

The DCLDATETIME is a structure used to hold date and time information.

DCLENVHANDLE

A DCLENVHANDLE is an opaque pointer which is used to reference an "environment" object which is created with DclEnvCreate().

DCLFSDIRHANDLE

DCLFSDIRHANDLE is an opaque pointer to a directory object which was opened with DclFsDirOpen().

DCLFSFILEHANDLE

DCLFSFILEHANDLE is an opaque pointer to a directory object which was opened with DclFsFileOpen().

DCLFSSTAT

DCLSTATUS DclFsStat(
    const char * pszPath,
    DCLFSSTAT * pStat);
The DCLFSSTAT structure type contains file system information returned by DclFsStat().

DCLFSSTATFS

DCLSTATUS DclFsStat()Fs(
    const char * pszDevName,
    DCLFSSTATFS * pStatFs);
The DCLFSSTATFS structure type contains file system information returned by DclFsStatFs().

DCLHRTIMESTAMP

A DCLHRTIMESTAMP type is used to track high-res timer infor- mation. This type must be operated on solely by the high-res timer functions -- software should not attempt to interpret the meaning of this type.

DCLINSTANCEHANDLE

DCLINSTANCEHANDLE DclInstanceHandle(unsigned nInstNum);
A DCLINSTANCEHANDLE is an opaque pointer used to refer to a DCL instance.

DCLIOSTATUS

Contains the results of an I/O request. The DCLIOSTATUS structure has the following layout: 

    +-----------------------------------------+
    |                                         |
    |  typedef struct                         |
    |  {                                      |
    |      D_UINT32    ulCount;               |
    |      DCLSTATUS   dclStat;               |
    |  } DCLIOSTATUS;                         |
    |                                         |
    +-----------------------------------------+

ulcount - The count of elements which were successfully transferred.
dclStat - The standard DCLSTATUS value.

The following methods are used to determine the state of an operation:

1) If dclStat == DCLSTAT_SUCCESS, then the operation was entirely successful. ulCount will indicate the count of elements transferred, however examining this value is not necessary.

2) If dclStat != DCLSTAT_SUCCESS, then the operation have been partially successful. ulCount will indicate the number of elements that were transferred successfully, if any. The element indicated by ulCount+1 will be the element where the error occurred. For write operations, it should be assumed that the element where the I/O error occurred was modified.

DCLLOADERFILEHANDLE

Type for a DL loader file handle.

DCLLOADERHANDLE

Type for a DL loader instance handle.

DCLLOGHANDLE

A DCLLOGHANDLE is used to reference a logging object which is created with DclLogOpen().

DCLPROJECTHANDLE

DCLPROJECTHANDLE DclProjectHandle( DCLINSTANCEHANDLE hDclInst);
A DCLPROJECTHANDLE is an opaque pointer used to refer to a project instance.

DCLREADERIO

Type for a DL loader block device instance handle.

DCLSERVICEHANDLE

A DCLSERVICEHANDLE is an opaque pointer used to refer to a service instance.

DCLSTATUS

A structured status code used to return error/status information.

DCLSTATUS is a 32-bit structured status code upon which all other product status codes are based. The code has the following layout: 

    +------------------------------------------------------+
    |                                                      |
    |             High 16-bits     -     Low 16-bits       |
    |          rccc rrrp pppp llll - llll ssss ssss ssss   |
    |          /\ / \ /\    / \         / \            /   |
    |  Reserved  |   |  \  /  |\       /   \          /|   |
    |          Class |CodeBase| \     /    Status Value|   |
    |            Reserved     | Locale                 |   |
    |                         |                        |   |
    |                         -------- Line Num --------   |
    |                         |                        |   |
    |                         --------  UINT20 ---------   |
    |                                                      |
    +------------------------------------------------------+

This bit-mapped status code is laid out to make it reasonably easy to decode the hex value at a glance. This is facilitated by ensuring that the major components of the status, the Class, CodeBase, Locale, and Status Value, are each aligned so their least signficant bits fall on a nybble boundary.

The "class" field defines the type of status code, which will be one of the following:

DCLSTATUSCLASS_ERROR - 1
DCLSTATUSCLASS_INFO - 2
DCLSTATUSCLASS_LINENUM - 3
DCLSTATUSCLASS_UINT20 - 4

The "CodeBase" field defines the code base in which the error originated. This value will identical to the product codes defined in dlprod.h.

The "Locale" field defines the location within the CodeBase where the error orginated. The following Locales are defined for DCL:

DCLLOCALE_GENERAL - 1
DCLLOCALE_OSSERV - 2
DCLLOCALE_INSTANCE - 3
DCLLOCALE_MEMORY - 4
DCLLOCALE_FILE - 5
DCLLOCALE_LOG - 6
DCLLOCALE_SHELL - 7
DCLLOCALE_ENV - 8
DCLLOCALE_DRIVERFW - 9
DCLLOCALE_PERFLOG - 10
DCLLOCALE_MISC - 11
DCLLOCALE_LOADER - 12
DCLLOCALE_TIME - 13
DCLLOCALE_WIN - 14

The "Status Value" is a unique status code within each Locale. See dlstatus.h for a detailed list of Locales and Status Values.

The DCLSTATUSCLASS_LINENUM is a special class of DCLSTATUS values where the locale and status bits together are used to indicate a line number.

The DCLSTATUSCLASS_UINT20 is a special class of DCLSTATUS values where the locale and status bits together are used to indicate a 20-bit unsigned integer value. The macros DCLSTAT_SETUINT20 and DCLSTAT_GETUINT20 are used to encode and decode these status values.

Several status codes have special definitions:

DCLSTAT_SUCCESS - This is the standard success status code.
DCLSTAT_FAILURE - This is the default status code for for failure, when a more specific status code is not defined. The use of specific status codes is highly preferable.

Along with DCLSTAT_SUCCESS and DCLSTAT_FAILURE, the entire Locale of "General" status codes is designed to be shared across products. Any product specific names are for convenience only -- the actual definition is the same across products, meaning that the "CodeBase" field for a "General" status code cannot be used to differentiate an identical status originating on one CodeBase versus another.

DCLTHREADATTR

The DCLTHREADATTR type is an opaque structure used to store thread attributes.

DCLTHREADHANDLE

The DCLTHREADHANDLE type is an opaque pointer to a thread object which was craeted by DclOsThreadCreate().

DCLTHREADID

The DCLTHREADID type is used to store a thread ID, as returned by DclOsThreadID().

DCLTIMER

A DCLTIMER structure is used by the timer services to track timing information. This structure is defined in a non-opaque fashion to allow it to be declared on the caller's stack to allow thread-safe implementations without requiring explicit memory allocations. However the contents of this structure are to be considered private to the timer functions and must not be manipulated by timer client code.

DCLTIMESTAMP

DCLTIMESTAMP DclTimeStamp(void);
A DCLTIMESTAMP type is used to track timer information. This type must be operated on solely by the timer functions -- software should not attempt to interpret the meaning of this type.

DCLTOOLPARAMS

A structure used to pass parameters to tests and tools.

PDCLMUTEX

The PDCLMUTEX type is an opaque pointer to a mutex object which was created with DclMutexCreate().

PDCLSEMAPHORE

The PDCLSEMAPHORE type is an opaque pointer to a counting semaphore object which was created with DclSemaphoreCreate().

PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR

The PDCLSEMAPHORERDWR type is an opaque pointer to a read/write semaphore object which was created with DclSemaphoreRdWrCreate().
